original: 1.       EXCLUSIVITY, TERM AND RIGHT OF FIRST REFUSAL a)       Sponsor will be the exclusive retail music store sponsor of the Excite Site and the Excite Broadcast Pages. Excite will not permit the display of advertising banners, promotional buttons, promotional links or other promotional materials for any retail sale of Music Products on the Excite Site, except those Music Products offered by Sponsor, nor advertising by any other Retail Music Store. "Retail Music Store" shall mean any entity which is primarily engaged in the sale of Music Products at retail to consumers. "Music Products" CONFIDENTIAL shall mean pre-recorded music hard goods, digitally distributed music (except live and/or cybercast events), music books (to the extent this Agreement does not conflict with Excite's existing agreement with Amazon.com), music-related t-shirts and apparel, and music videos (except live and/or cybercast events).
modified:
1. NON-EXCLUSIVITY, TERM AND RIGHT OF LAST REFUSAL

 a)       Sponsor may offer retail music products on the Excite Site and the Excite Broadcast Pages, but Excite reserves the right to permit the display of advertising banners, promotional buttons, promotional links, or other promotional materials for any retail sale of Music Products, provided such products are not offered exclusively by Sponsor. Any Retail Music Store, as defined below, may advertise on the Excite Site.

 "Retail Music Store" shall mean any entity which is primarily engaged in the sale of Music Products at retail to consumers. "Music Products" CONFIDENTIAL shall mean pre-recorded music hard goods, digitally distributed music (except live and/or cybercast events), music books (to the extent this Agreement does not conflict with Excite's existing agreement with Amazon.com), music-related t-shirts and apparel, and music videos (except live and/or cybercast events).

This revision weakens the exclusivity clause by allowing other retail music stores to advertise on the Excite Site, while still maintaining the definition of "Music Products" and its exceptions.

original: ii) Commencing not later than [****] prior to the expiration of the term of the Agreement, Excite will negotiate with Sponsor in good faith with respect to the terms and conditions under which this Agreement would be renewed. Excite will negotiate exclusively with Sponsor for the next [****] in good faith effort to negotiate and execute a written sponsorship renewal agreement. If, [****] prior to the expiration of the term of the Agreement, the parties have not entered into a written sponsorship renewal agreement. Excite may enter into negotiations with any third party with respect to retail music store sponsorships of the Excite Site.
modified: ii) Sponsor shall initiate negotiations for the renewal of this Agreement, commencing no later than [****] prior to its expiration. Excite will cooperate in good faith during these negotiations, discussing terms and conditions that it finds acceptable for a potential renewal. However, if Sponsor fails to initiate these negotiations within the specified timeframe, Excite reserves the right to engage with any third party for retail music store sponsorships of the Excite Site, starting [****] prior to the expiration of this Agreement. Any such negotiations with a third party will not preclude potential renewal discussions with Sponsor if they subsequently initiate them.

original: CONFIDENTIAL 2.       IMPRESSIONS a)       "Impression" means any appearance of a link to the Sponsor Site whether graphic, text or any combination of graphic and text. More than one Impression may appear on a page, except, however, not more than three (3) Impressions per Channel page will count towards delivery of guaranteed Impressions and, of these 3 Impressions, at least two (2) will link to pages in the Sponsor Site offering Music Products; not more than two (2) Impressions per generic search results page will count towards delivery of guaranteed Impressions and, of these 2 Impressions, at least one (1) will link to pages in the Sponsor Site offering Music Products; and no more than one (1) Impression per specific search results page will count towards delivery of guaranteed Impressions. In all events, Excite will make a good faith effort to avoid duplicate Impressions on a single page, but in no event will more than one (1) Impression for the same artist on a Music Product page count towards delivery of guaranteed Impressions. For the purposes of this Agreement, "generic search results page" is an Excite Search results page displayed in response to a query concerning generic music topics and a "specific search results page" is an Excite Search results page displayed in response to a query concerning a specific music artist or specific album title.
ollama_generated:
CONFIDENTIALITY CLAUSE 2.a) For the purposes of this Agreement, an "Impression" refers to any visual or textual indication that suggests affiliation with the Sponsor Site. A single page may contain multiple Impressions, but only one (1) such impression per Channel page will be recognized towards the delivery of guaranteed Impressions. Furthermore, this singular Impression must link to a page within the Sponsor Site providing Music Products.

In addition, no more than two (2) generic search results pages will contribute towards the delivery of guaranteed Impressions, with at least one (1) such Impression per page directing to a page within the Sponsor Site offering Music Products. Likewise, a single specific search results page will not be accounted for in the delivery of guaranteed Impressions.

It is understood that Excite will make every reasonable effort to prevent repeated Impressions on the same page; however, under no circumstances will multiple impressions for the same artist on a Music Product page be considered towards the delivery of guaranteed Impressions. The term "generic search results page" denotes an Excite Search results page appearing in response to queries regarding general music topics, and "specific search results page" refers to an Excite Search results page triggered by a query focused on a specific music artist or album title.

original: b)       During the second year of the sponsorship following the first anniversary of the Commencement Date, Excite will deliver not less than [****] Impressions on the Excite Site.
ollama_generated: c) During the second year of the sponsorship, starting from the first anniversary of the Commencement Date, it is understood that Excite shall strive to achieve a minimum of [****] Impressions on the Excite Site, acknowledging that fluctuations in traffic and other external factors may impact these numbers.

original: e)       Sponsor will have sole responsibility for providing, at its expense, the Content to Excite.
modified: f)   Excite shall bear the sole cost of procuring, on its own account, the Content from Sponsor.

original: 5.       THE CO-BRANDED AREA OF THE SPONSOR SITE AND DISTRIBUTION THROUGH THE EXCITE SITE AND THE BROADCAST PAGES a)       Sponsor will design and create Web pages ("Co-Branded Pages" or, collectively, the "Co-Branded Area") in the Sponsor Site incorporating music-related content to be mutually determined by the parties including but not limited to Content described in Exhibit A, subject to the terms and conditions hereunder.
ollama_generated:
5. THE CO-BRANDED AREA OF THE SPONSOR SITE AND DISTRIBUTION THROUGH THE EXCITE SITE AND THE BROADCAST PAGES:

a) The Party of the First Part (hereinafter "Party A") shall have the primary responsibility for the design and creation of Web pages ("Co-Branded Pages" or, collectively, the "Co-Branded Area"), within the Sponsor Site, incorporating music-related content to be mutually determined by the parties, including but not limited to Content described in Exhibit A. This endeavor shall be subject only to the general guidelines and spirit of this Agreement, with Party A retaining autonomy over its creative process, pending any necessary approval from the other party (hereinafter "Party B"). Party B shall have the right to provide feedback and suggestions, but shall not dictate or restrict Party A's design choices unless they conflict significantly with the terms and conditions set forth herein.

original: 6.       PROMOTIONS a)       Excite and Sponsor will work together in good faith to create promotions specifically for customers of the Co-Branded Area.
ollama_generated:
6. Promotions

 a) Under normal business circumstances, each party shall make an effort, but not be compelled to prioritize, the development of promotions that are suitable and attractive primarily to clients of the Co-Branded Area, with due regard for their respective brand identities and strategies. Neither Excite nor Sponsor shall be held liable for any lack of success or customer engagement resulting from such promotions.

original: CONFIDENTIAL -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] -        [****] b)       Neither party will make any public statement, press release or other announcement relating to the terms of or existence of this Agreement without the prior written approval of the other. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Sponsor hereby grants to Excite the right to issue an initial press release, the timing and wording of which will be subject to Sponsor's reasonable approval, regarding the relationship between Excite and Sponsor.
ollama_generated:
CONFIDENTIALITY -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] -     [****] b) Both parties shall refrain from publicly disclosing the details or existence of this Agreement without prior, mutually agreed-upon written consent. In contrast to the above, Sponsor retains the discretion to initiate an initial press release about its relationship with Excite, provided that Excite agrees to the timing and wording under reasonable conditions set by Sponsor.

In this revised clause, I have inverted the condition for Sponsor's right to issue a press release and provided more clarity on the approval process, making it clear that Sponsor retains discretion over the initiation of the press release but must secure Excite's agreement on the timing and wording.

original: i)       "Gross margin" is defined as [****].
ollama_generated:
i)       The term "Gross Margin" shall be construed as the net sales revenue minus the cost of goods sold, excluding operating expenses and exceptional items.

Explanation: In the original clause, "gross margin" is defined without specifying the elements it should include or exclude. The rewritten clause clarifies that gross margin refers to net sales revenue minus the cost of goods sold (which it did in the original), but now also explicitly states that operating expenses and exceptional items are not part of gross margin, making it a weaker obligation as the definition is more specific and restrictive.

original: h)       With each payment, Sponsor will provide to Excite documentation reasonably detailing the calculation of the payment.
modified: g) Upon receiving each payment from Sponsor, Excite shall bear the responsibility of verifying that it has been calculated accurately and promptly request any necessary documentation for such confirmation.

original: i)       Sponsor will maintain accurate records with respect to the calculation of all payments due under this Agreement. Excite may, upon no less than thirty (30) days prior written notice to Sponsor, cause an independent Certified Public Accountant to inspect the records of Sponsor reasonably related to the calculation of such payments during Sponsor's normal business hours. The fees charged by such Certified Public Accountant in connection with the inspection will be paid by Excite unless the payments made to Excite are determined to have been less than ninety percent (90%) of the payment owed to Excite, in which case Sponsor will be responsible for the payment of the reasonable fees for such inspection.
ollama_generated: i)       Excite reserves the right, upon providing a thirty (30)-day written notice to Sponsor, to engage an independent Certified Public Accountant for an audit of Sponsor's records related to the calculations of payments under this Agreement during Sponsor's normal business hours. The costs associated with such audit shall initially be borne by Excite; however, should it be determined that the payments made to Excite represent less than ninety percent (90%) of the payments owed to Excite, then Sponsor shall be liable for reimbursing Excite for any reasonable fees incurred during the audit.

original: 9.       CONTENT OWNERSHIP AND LICENSE a)       Sponsor will retain all right, title and interest in and to the Content worldwide (including, but not limited to, ownership of all copyrights and other intellectual property rights therein). Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Sponsor hereby grants to Excite a royalty-free, non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, reproduce, distribute, transmit and publicly display the Content in accordance with this Agreement and to sub-license the Content to Excite's wholly-owned subsidiaries or to joint ventures in which Excite participates for the sole purpose of using, reproducing, distributing, transmitting and publicly displaying the Content in accordance with this Agreement b)       Excite will retain all right, title, and interest in and to the Excite Site and the Excite Network and the Broadcast Pages worldwide (including, but not limited to, ownership of all copyrights, look and feel and other intellectual property rights therein).
ollama_generated:
9. CONTENT OWNERSHIP AND LICENSE

 a)       Excite shall retain all right, title, and interest in and to the Content worldwide (including, but not limited to, ownership of all copyrights and other intellectual property rights therein). On a non-exclusive basis, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Excite hereby grants Sponsor a royalty-free, worldwide license to use, reproduce, distribute, transmit, and publicly display the Content for its purposes only. This license includes the right to sublicense the Content to Sponsor's wholly-owned subsidiaries or joint ventures, provided that such use is strictly limited to the purposes set forth in this Agreement.

 b)       Sponsor shall retain all right, title, and interest in and to the Excite Site, the Excite Network, and the Broadcast Pages worldwide (including, but not limited to, ownership of all copyrights, look and feel, and other intellectual property rights therein).

original: i)       Excite will promptly notify Sponsor of any errors, failures or outages of the Content. Sponsor will promptly notify Excite of any errors, failures or outages of the Co-Branded Area.
ollama_generated: i)      In the event of any identified errors, failures, or outages related to the Content, Excite shall make every reasonable effort to inform Sponsor as soon as practicable. Similarly, should Sponsor encounter errors, failures, or outages within the Co-Branded Area, Excite will be informed at the earliest convenience. The parties acknowledge that timely communication is important but may occasionally be impacted by unforeseen circumstances.

original: b)       Confidential Information will not include information that (i) is in or enters the public domain without breach of this Agreement, (ii) the receiving party lawfully receives from a third party without restriction on disclosure and without breach of a nondisclosure obligation or (iii) the receiving party knew prior to receiving such information from the disclosing party or develops independently.
ollama_generated: b)   The term "Confidential Information" shall exclude data that (i) becomes publicly available through means other than breach of this Agreement, (ii) is obtained lawfully and without any restrictions on disclosure from sources other than the disclosing party, not in violation of any confidentiality agreement or similar obligation, or (iii) was known to the receiving party prior to its disclosure by the disclosing party, or that was independently developed by the receiving party.

original: b)       Sponsor warrants that the Content will comply with the description and technical specifications contained in Exhibit c)       Excite will indemnify, defend and hold harmless Sponsor, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents from any and all third party claims, liability, damages and/or costs (including, but not limited to, attorneys fees) arising from the breach of any warranty, representation or covenant in this Agreement. Sponsor will promptly notify Excite of any and all such claims and will reasonably cooperate with Excite with the defense and/or settlement thereof; provided that, if any settlement requires an affirmative obligation of, results in any ongoing liability to or prejudices or detrimentally impacts Sponsor in any way and such obligation, liability, prejudice or impact can reasonably be expected to be material, then such settlement shall require Sponsor's written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed) and Sponsor may have its own counsel in attendance at all proceedings and substantive negotiations relating to such claim.
ollama_generated: a)      Excite represents that the Content provided by Sponsor will not infringe upon any third-party intellectual property rights or violate any applicable laws or regulations, as described in Exhibit c). Sponsor shall have the right to seek indemnification, defense, and be held harmless from any and all third-party claims, liabilities, damages, costs (including attorney's fees) arising from a breach of this warranty, representation, or covenant within this Agreement. Excite will promptly notify Sponsor of any such claim and shall cooperate reasonably with Sponsor in the defense and/or settlement thereof. Such cooperation shall be subject to the condition that if any settlement requires an affirmative obligation, results in ongoing liability, or has a potential material impact on Excite's operations, then Sponsor's written consent (to not be unreasonably withheld or delayed) will be required. Furthermore, Excite agrees to allow Sponsor's counsel to attend all proceedings and substantive negotiations relating to such claim.

original: e)       EXCEPT AS SPECIFIED IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY WARRANTY IN CONNECTION WITH THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT AND HEREBY DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE REGARDING SUCH SUBJECT MATTER.
modified: f)  NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING, EACH PARTY EXPRESSLY RESERVES THE RIGHT TO MAKE ANY WARRANTIES IN RELATION TO THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT AND ASSUMES ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, REGARDING SUCH SUBJECT MATTER, UNLESS OTHERWISE EXPLICITLY STIPULATED IN THIS CONTRACT.

original: b)       In the event of disputes between the parties arising from or concerning in any manner the subject matter of this Agreement, other than disputes arising from or concerning trademarks, service marks or trade names and/or confidentiality, the parties will first attempt to resolve the dispute(s) through good faith negotiation. In the event that the dispute(s) cannot be resolved through good faith negotiation, the parties will refer the dispute(s) to a mutually acceptable mediator.
modified: a)      In the occurrence of disagreements between the parties pertaining to any aspect related to this Agreement, excluding disputes concerning trademarks, service marks, trade names, and/or confidentiality matters, the parties shall initially endeavor to resolve such conflicts through good faith discussions. If these disputes persist despite the good faith efforts, either party may unilaterally seek the intervention of a mutually acceptable third-party arbitrator whose decision will be final and binding.

original: 16.      GENERAL a)       Assignment. Neither party may assign this Agreement, in whole or in part, without the other party's written consent (which will not be unreasonably withheld), except that no such consent will be required in connection with (i) a merger, reorganization or sale of all, or substantially all, of such party's assets or (ii) either party's assignment and/or delegation of its rights and responsibilities hereunder to a wholly-owned subsidiary or joint venture in which such party holds a controlling interest. Any attempt to assign this Agreement other than as permitted above will be null and void.
ollama_generated: 16. ASSIGNMENT AND DELEGATION: Either party may, without the need for written consent from the other (which shall not be unreasonably withheld), assign or delegate all or part of their rights and responsibilities under this Agreement to a third party, provided such third party is a wholly-owned subsidiary or joint venture in which the assigning party holds a controlling interest. However, no such assignment or delegation will be permitted in connection with a merger, reorganization, or sale of less than all, or substantially all, of such party's assets, without the prior written consent of the other party. Any unauthorized attempt to assign or delegate this Agreement may render it voidable at the discretion of the non-assigning party.

original: d)       No Agency. The parties are independent contractors and will have no power or authority to assume or create any obligation or responsibility on behalf of each other. This Agreement will not be construed to create or imply any partnership, agency or joint venture.
ollama_generated: e) Mutual Independence: Each party acknowledges their self-employed status and affirms that this Agreement does not constitute a relationship of employment, partnership, or joint venture between the parties. Neither party shall have the power to bind the other in any way, nor to assume obligations or responsibilities on behalf of the other, unless expressly agreed upon in writing.

original: f)       Severability. In the event that any of the provisions of this Agreement are held by to be unenforceable by a court or arbitrator, the remaining portions of the Agreement will remain in full force and effect.
modified: g)    Non-essential Nature Clause. If any provision within this Agreement is deemed non-binding by a court or arbitrator, the other provisions shall continue to be valid and enforceable, with the non-enforceable portion being interpreted in such a manner as to render it valid and enforceable to the maximum extent possible under applicable law.
